channel.title: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)
channel.description:
Ok this is what I have so far. I know that it's not that great. I tried hard on this one. Spent roughly an estimated time of about 2 hours or so. Here it is
[IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg129/Omega1210/Megaman4BrushesV4.png[/img]
I know I screwed it up a little(or some ppl may say a lot) but idk how to go from here. I tried using brushstrokes but none of the default ones I have really match them. Anyone know any good brushes that would go good with this sig?
Please tell me what parts I messed up on. And tel me how I can fix my problems. =]. Thanks
My View, I think that the Lighting is too bright, and also that little glare in the top right corner. And the lighting on the hand is screwed up. And there isnt' enough brushing.

planetrenders.com

heres how you install brushes in gimp
http://www.gimptalk.com/forum/topic/How-To-Install-Brushes-1315-1.html[/quote]
I have accs on Gimptalk and planet renders.

http://www.delta-visions.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=1275

The owner of that topic who posted the 200 TuTs came from here. A member of Sythe just posted it on Sythe.org.

Read full topic

item.source: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)

item.title: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @OmidSan OmidSan
item.description:
@OmidSan wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:12, topic:190896”]I have to agree with Javis, I always suggest using Grunge tutorials when it comes to beginners. They’re very simple, and explain some of the basic effects of the program. This one is an improvement upon your others. But, you need to stray away from the Lens Flare, those are rarely used. Most noobs use them, thinking they add a cool effect. They look nasty. Only in some cases do they actually work.

When using renders, you must remember to remove the name of the person who rendered the picture. Sometimes it may be nice to leave credit. But it interferes with the rest of the image. The quality of the render is also important, in fact, so important, you need to double check yourself when choosing one. And spend a good amount of time reviewing possible choices. This one is very grainy, and the opacity is turned down. This may be your doing. But it detracts from the rest of the image.

I’ll remove the name next time. I promise. =P. I think I did screw up the render a bit. Here’s the original.
http://planetrenders.net/renders/displayimage.php?pos=-15439

K then, tomorrow I’ll go on the hunt for some good grunge TuTs. =]

1/10. You’ll improve, just find some good understandable tuts.[/quote]
Yeah, I won’t use that lens flare anymore. Over the next week I’m gonna have a lotta free time cause of Spring Break so i’l start doing some Grunge TuTs and post up my outcomes on here.

Read full topic
item.source: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)

item.title: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I have to agree with Javis, I always suggest using Grunge tutorials when it comes to beginners. They’re very simple, and explain some of the basic effects of the program. This one is an improvement upon your others. But, you need to stray away from the Lens Flare, those are rarely used. Most noobs use them, thinking they add a cool effect. They look nasty. Only in some cases do they actually work.

When using renders, you must remember to remove the name of the person who rendered the picture. Sometimes it may be nice to leave credit. But it interferes with the rest of the image. The quality of the render is also important, in fact, so important, you need to double check yourself when choosing one. And spend a good amount of time reviewing possible choices. This one is very grainy, and the opacity is turned down. This may be your doing. But it detracts from the rest of the image.

1/10. You’ll improve, just find some good understandable tuts.

Read full topic

item.title: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @javis javis
item.description:
@javis wrote:

and thinking frell is saying for future reference use better renders. But i suppose you could always duplicate your render layer and then go to filter>enhance>sharpen and sharpen it by like 60 then set that layer to w/e looks good.

Read full topic

item.source: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)

item.title: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @OmidSan OmidSan
item.description:
@OmidSan wrote:

[quote=“javis, post:3, topic:190896”]lol unid your smudging tag was, well bad.

Try a grunge sig. Those are probably the easiest tuts to follow.

I can see what you where going for with the lense flairs but it didnt work lol. your over whoring those black lines around the tag. Id recomend loosing them. background is the clouds pattern filter with x and y set to full? your improving but it still needs work.

Also a word of advice when using a render remove the person who made it’s lable. Its right to the left of your renders head[/quote]
Ty javis, i’ll look for a grunge TuT and try one tomorrow. Lol I always screwup with the lens. I used a brush I got for the background with the clouds pattern.
yeah I know, I forgot to delete the dude who made it. I"ll do it next time.

Also, I did make the left hand too bright (it would be his right, lol). I’ll try to improve on that.[quote=“javis, post:7, topic:190896”]I think he said hes saving them as png[/quote]
Yep, I’m doing png like u told me javis.

Read full topic

item.source: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)

item.title: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @javis javis
item.description:
@javis wrote:

lol unid your smudging tag was, well bad.

Try a grunge sig. Those are probably the easiest tuts to follow.

I can see what you where going for with the lense flairs but it didnt work lol. your over whoring those black lines around the tag. Id recomend loosing them. background is the clouds pattern filter with x and y set to full? your improving but it still needs work.

Also a word of advice when using a render remove the person who made it’s lable. Its right to the left of your renders head

Read full topic
item.source: Another Try at Making a Sig (Help needed)
